Content: @dukeleto an evap basically works like an ac, but both sides of the air are in the same space

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: it "drains away" the condensation

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: basically it's like running the air going out over both the hot and cold sides of the fins

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: so the temp remains close to the same

Author: Cryptoon#3362

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: most AC units are heat pumps nowadays I believe?

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
`household heatpumps take warmer air from outside to warm floor heating or whatever at a more than 100% efficiency rate`
they do exactly not that, unless they are "geothermal"/"ground-source"
a household "heat pump" is nothing more than an AC unit with a "reversing valve" that constricts the gas flow and forces it in the opposite direction

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: ehm you can have air -> water heat pumps?

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heat_pump#Air_source_heat_pump

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: eg at parents house they have a heat pump that goes air > water to warm water and floor heating

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: combined with solar cells you pretty much have free heating

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: efficiency is much less with temps below +-5춿C
